adjective.description: Excluding or not admitting other things.
examples: my exclusive focus is on San Antonio issues

adjective.description: Restricted or limited to the person, group, or area concerned.
examples: the couple had exclusive possession of the condo
the jaguar and puma are exclusive to the New World

adjective.description: Catering or available to only a few, select people; high class and expensive.

examples: prices are exclusive of tax and delivery

noun.description: An item or story published or broadcast by only one source.

origin: Late 15th century (as a noun denoting something that excludes): from medieval Latin exclusivus, from Latin excludere shut out (see exclude).
